23. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your memory which you would like to recount?

In the fall of 1884, we had a hard winter. We had to make do without many things that we took for granted today. We had to be resourceful and creative to survive. The snow was deep, and the temperatures were extremely low. We had to build our own shelter using whatever materials we could find. We faced many challenges, but we persevered and emerged stronger from the experience.
